activities: Ancestry.com Inc is the world leader in genealogical research.  This certification applies to Ancestry.com as well as to www.ancestry.ca, www.ancestry.de, www.ancestry.it, www.ancestry.ie, www.ancestry.com.au, www.ancestry.co.uk, www.ancestry.se, www.ancestry.fr, www.ancestry.mx, world.ancestry.com and its offline products.  Ancestry web servers based in the United States process and host personal data of EEA and Swiss users and subscribers of Ancestry web properties.  Ancestry web properties primarily collect personal data directly from users and subscribers, who voluntarily upload their family-tree information and control who can see living individuals' data.  The data they upload may include EU sensitive data.  Ancestry staff also gather EEA and Swiss public records, which may occasionally contain living individuals' data.  These collections are processed and stored in the United States. Ancestry also maintains employees in the EEA and processes and hosts their employment data in the United States for customary and usual workforce-management purposes.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: off-line, on-line, manually processed customer and HR data
recoursemech: For organization human resources data: EU data protection authorities (DPAs) and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC); for all other data: TRUSTe
